column1: #Text=Unify log management and infrastructure performance with SolarWinds Log Analyzer.
#Text=Easy-to-use system and application change monitoring with Server Configuration Monitor.
#Text=Monitor your cloud-native Azure SQL databases with a cloud-native monitoring solution.
#Text=Help Reduce Insider Threat Risks with SolarWinds® Access Rights Manager
#Text=Manage and Audit Access Rights across your Infrastructure.
#Text=SolarWinds Service Desk is a 2020 TrustRadius Winner
#Text=Service Desk is a winner in two categories: IT Asset Management and IT Service Management (ITSM)
#Text=SaaS-based infrastructure and application performance monitoring, tracing, and custom metrics for hybrid and cloud-custom applications.
#Text=Infrastructure and application performance monitoring for commercial off-the-shelf and SaaS applications; built on the SolarWinds® Orion® platform.
#Text=Fast and powerful hosted aggregation, analytics and visualization of terabytes of machine data across hybrid applications, cloud applications, and infrastructure.
#Text=Monitoring and visualization of machine data from applications and infrastructure inside the firewall, extending the SolarWinds® Orion® platform.
#Text=Real-time live tailing, searching, and troubleshooting for cloud applications and environments.
#Text=Real user, and synthetic monitoring of web applications from outside the firewall.
#Text=Web application performance monitoring from inside the firewall.
#Text=AppOptics: Next-gen SaaS-based application performance & infrastructure monitoring.
#Text=Accelerates the identification and getting to the root cause of application performance issues.
#Text=Built to help maximize efficiency and scale.
#Text=Get a comprehensive set of RMM tools to efficiently secure, maintain, and improve your clients’ IT systems.
#Text=Manage backup for servers, workstations, applications, and business documents from one cloud-based dashboard.
#Text=Protect users from email threats and downtime.
#Text=Easily adopt and demonstrate best practice password and documentation management workflows.
#Text=Manage ticketing, reporting, and billing to increase helpdesk efficiency.
#Text=Help support customers and their devices with remote support tools designed to be fast and powerful.
#Text=Bringing together N-able RMM and Microsoft Intune management capabilities.
#Text=Renew to download the latest product features, get 24/7 tech support, and access to instructor-led training.
#Text=Find product guides, documentation, training, onboarding information, and support articles.
#Text=Submit a ticket for technical and product assistance, or get customer service help.
#Text=Learn through self-study, instructor-led, and on-demand classes with the SolarWinds Academy.
#Text=Download the latest product versions and hotfixes.
#Text=Manage your portal account and all your products.
#Text=Get help, be heard by us and do your job better using our products.
#Text=Get practical advice on managing IT infrastructure from up-and-coming industry voices and well-known tech leaders.
#Text=Find articles, code and a community of database experts.
#Text=Get the latest SolarWinds investigation updates, advice from leading cybersecurity experts we’re working with, and learn about our Secure by Design journey.
#Text=SolarWinds is a 2020 TrustRadius Winner in SQL Server Performance Monitoring and Database Performance Monitoring
#Text=Quickly identify causes of MySQL problems and get tuning advice
#Text=Get a complete picture of MySQL performance with multi-dimensional database performance analysis
#Text=Get a complete picture of MySQL performance with multi-dimensional database performance analysis

#Text=SolarWinds® Database Performance Analyzer (DPA) offers multi-dimensional performance analysis, which is built to correlate response time, server resources, SQL statements, wait events/types, and relevant context.
#Text=This helps give you a complete picture of MySQL performance, allowing you to quickly identify the root cause of complex performance problems.
#Text=DPA is designed to constantly look at thousands of metrics possibly contributing to application performance issues, so you can pinpoint what happened at any given time.
#Text=View wait-based response time analytics to help identify the cause of MySQL slowdowns
#Text=View wait-based response time analytics to help identify the cause of MySQL slowdowns
#Text=Traditional database monitoring tools have dashboards showing hundreds of meaningless numbers requiring extensive analysis.
#Text=Current application performance management tools provide hints, but they don’t help you find root causes.
#Text=SolarWinds DPA is a powerful tool built to address these gaps.
#Text=DPA also incorporates wait time analysis, so it focuses on the speed at which the database responds to application requests instead of health.
#Text=This can offer users a pragmatic approach to determining what causes MySQL slowdowns.
#Text=Easily collaborate across teams with a focus on MySQL performance
#Text=Easily collaborate across teams with a focus on MySQL performance

#Text=With DPA, all teams can see a complete and accurate performance view of the database, applications, host OS, server, network, and storage systems from a dashboard capable of covering multiple database technologies, whether they’re on-premises or in the cloud.
#Text=This shared view is designed to eliminate guessing and finger-pointing, since developers and operations teams can see the effects of any changes they make from a single source.
#Text=View detailed historical analysis and dynamic baselines for greater context around your MySQL server
#Text=View detailed historical analysis and dynamic baselines for greater context around your MySQL server
#Text=DPA doesn’t just work in real time; it also includes historical data analysis.

#Text=SolarWinds DPA can collate data points from two years ago or from a few seconds ago with one-second resolution, and it presents the results in easy-to-understand charts capable of leading to more detailed data surrounding an issue.
#Text=This historical data analysis can help you more easily identify opportunities for improvement so your MySQL optimization doesn’t just revolve around reactively fixing problems.
#Text=Instead, historical data analysis can help you make proactive changes.
#Text=Monitor a range of MySQL performance metrics with DPA
#Text=Monitor a range of MySQL performance metrics with DPA
#Text=MySQL database performance monitoring is essential for optimization.
#Text=DPA is designed to track a range of MySQL database performance metrics, allowing for multi-dimensional analysis depending on the issue and your organization’s needs.
#Text=DPA is built to monitor metrics like the following:
#Text=Buffer pool usage (InnoDB data, including buffer pool utilization and reads)
#Text=Query execution performance (query run time, query errors, slow queries)
#Text=What does a MySQL performance monitoring tool do?
#Text=How does MySQL performance monitoring work in DPA?
#Text=MySQL database performance monitoring is the process of tracking metrics related to how MySQL is functioning.
#Text=This process can help catch issues and ensure the database continues to support the function of other applications and systems.
#Text=MySQL is an open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) based on Structured Query Language (SQL).
#Text=Because it’s based on SQL, MySQL users don’t need to learn new commands to use the system.
#Text=This ease of use is just one of the reasons MySQL is the world’s most popular open-source relational database server.
#Text=However, admins still need to understand how to optimize its performance, which requires MySQL performance monitoring and tuning.
#Text=The basic work of a database is to run queries.
#Text=When MySQL performance isn’t at the level you expect, a variety of factors may be causing the issue.
#Text=It’s possible the issue could relate to hardware and a lack of memory; it could also be a problem with the way queries are being written or indexed.
#Text=There might even be an issue in the cache.
#Text=The only way to determine what’s causing poor performance is to monitor all the elements in your system capable of impacting MySQL performance.

#Text=This involves monitoring metrics related to the database server and the speed at which it executes queries, and it involves monitoring all other system metrics with a potential impact on MySQL performance.
#Text=To monitor MySQL performance, the database administrator collects and interprets metrics related to MySQL server performance and identifies when and why performance issues are arising.
#Text=The MySQL performance monitor then uses this information to determine and tackle the root cause of the problem and return performance to normal.
#Text=Ideally, admins can use the insights gained from monitoring to proactively improve MySQL performance before issues arise.
#Text=There are hundreds of metrics capable of providing useful information about what could be causing or contributing to a performance failure.
#Text=Some of these metrics—like CPU usage, load, swap usage, memory usage, disk usage, and network bandwidth—relate to your system.
#Text=Given that MySQL engages with the entire system, sometimes issues with MySQL can be caused by problems outside the server itself.

#Text=Effective monitoring involves keeping tabs on these system metrics in addition to the plethora of performance metrics directly related to the MySQL server, like query run time, query errors, slow queries, questions, read/writes, and more.
#Text=If you want to optimize MySQL, monitor the performance of your whole system and not just the database server.
#Text=By monitoring metrics from across the system, you can gain insights to help you maintain or improve query execution times.
#Text=Monitoring MySQL performance is important because it helps you make sure the database server is executing queries as expected.
#Text=This, in turn, helps ensure end users don’t experience application slowdowns, and it can help keep business productivity high.

#Text=When performance problems occur, monitoring MySQL performance reports and the metrics they contain can help you quickly get to the bottom of the issue, so you can begin troubleshooting solutions.
#Text=Effective monitoring lets you do more than just be reactive when performance issues arise—it also gives you the power to proactively improve MySQL performance.
#Text=With a quality MySQL performance monitoring tool, you can identify opportunities to improve your MySQL performance even if the monitoring systems are showing all green.
#Text=Beyond simply improving performance, MySQL performance monitoring can save you money.
#Text=Any database application or server will hit hardware limits at a certain point.
#Text=Often, the easiest fix seems to be buying more hardware.
#Text=However, if there’s an underlying problem causing resources to be wasted, you might find yourself continuously spending money on more hardware and not solving the problem.
#Text=By finding and addressing the underlying issues making you hit hardware limits, you can reduce your costs.
#Text=What does a MySQL performance monitoring tool do?
#Text=A MySQL performance monitoring tool is built to consistently measure the hundreds of metrics tied to the database server’s performance and alert you when an issue requires your attention.
#Text=Don’t manually search through metrics—a monitoring tool can automatically provide you with the information you need to understand performance problems.
#Text=Monitoring tools are built to pull out and correlate the relevant metrics to give you a complete picture of your MySQL performance.

#Text=From system metrics like CPU and memory to specific metrics about queries, questions, logs, errors, and more, a MySQL performance monitor tool is designed to track everything and alert you when the system crosses problematic thresholds.
#Text=Beyond sending alerts, a quality performance monitoring tool can help you identify the root cause of performance issues.
#Text=By directing you to the proper metrics, it can help you better focus your efforts.

#Text=Unlike regular monitoring, which only lets you see current performance metrics, a good MySQL performance monitoring tool provides historical trend analysis, so you can see whether the problems you’re experiencing have a historical precedent.
#Text=Without this analysis, it’s nearly impossible to identify how performance has changed, what’s normal, and what has caused problems in the past.
#Text=How does MySQL performance monitoring work in DPA?
#Text=SolarWinds® Database Performance Analyzer for MySQL is designed to take the heavy lifting out of MySQL performance monitoring.

#Text=The tool is built to monitor metrics specific to MySQL and those related to your broader system, collecting and correlating the ones most important to optimizing MySQL performance and alerting you when a metric demands your attention.
#Text=With DPA, you can easily isolate and target the root cause of performance issues.
#Text=With the tool’s historical trend analysis, you can see how performance has changed and whether the problems you’re experiencing now are related to past problems.
#Text=If you just want to focus on what’s happening right now, this is possible thanks to the “current view” in DPA.
#Text=With easy-to-understand bar charts, the DPA monitoring dashboard is built to offer you a simplified visual understanding of your data.
#Text=With DPA, you don’t have to wait for something to go wrong before you begin improving MySQL performance.
#Text=DPA allows you to more easily gain insights to help you make improvements and optimize performance, even when your entire dashboard is green.

#Text=With DPA, you can rest easy knowing the thousands of metrics related to MySQL performance are constantly being monitored and you’ll be alerted as soon as any of these metrics demand your attention.

#Text="This product is invaluable to my team for problem resolution.
